description_txt: stated on January 20, 2015 in the Republican response to the State of the Union address:
quote_txt: "A strong majority of Americans support" the Keystone XL pipeline.

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2015 in his 2015 State of the Union address:
quote_txt: We've seen "our deficits cut by two-thirds."

description_txt: stated on January 8, 2015 in a speech in Phoenix, Ariz.:
quote_txt: "Today, home sales are up nearly 50 percent from where they were in the worst of the crisis."

description_txt: stated on January 9, 2015 in a speech in Knoxville, Tenn.:
quote_txt: "We’ve doubled the production of clean energy."

description_txt: stated on January 5, 2015 in an editorial board interview with the Concord Monitor:
quote_txt: "If you ask how many times did Ronald Reagan attend a fundraiser when he ran for re-election in 1984, the answer is eight times. If you say how many times did Barack Obama attend a fundraiser in 2012, the answer is 228 times."

description_txt: stated on January 7, 2015 in a speech in Wayne. Mich.:
quote_txt: Over the past five years, the American automobile industry has "created about 500,000 new jobs."

description_txt: stated on January 9, 2015 in remarks in Clinton, Tenn.:
quote_txt: "Factories are opening their doors at the fastest pace in almost two decades."

description_txt: stated on January 9, 2015 in at Media Symposium:
quote_txt:
The state covered a smaller percentage of the cost of K-12 education in 2013 than it did
in 2002.

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2015 in a newspaper opinion piece:
quote_txt: Federal officials declared that grant funds "could be used only for Milwaukee's streetcar project," meaning it "isn’t possible" to redirect the money to "other modes of public transportation or to our public schools."

description_txt: stated on January 18, 2015 in an interview on "Fox News Sunday":
quote_txt: "Supreme Court 15 times over the last 120 years has said marriage is a fundamental right" and never said "it had to be between a man and a woman."

description_txt: stated on January 18, 2015 in an interview on ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: Says Mitt Romney "pays less tax than the guys who installed his car elevators."

description_txt: stated on December 26, 2014 in a Providence Journal commentary:
quote_txt: Says Nikita Khrushchev brought an extra shoe to a United Nations session in 1960, which he banged on the desk in protest.
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • January 18, 2015

description_txt: stated on January 9, 2015 in a news release.:
quote_txt: President Barack Obama’s policies "have resulted in gas prices being reduced from $3.07 per gallon when he was sworn in in 2009 to $2.30 today."

description_txt: stated on January 15, 2015 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: Says he "balanced the budget without raising taxes."

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2015 in a speech in New Hampshire:
quote_txt: "Over half the people on disability are either anxious or their back hurts."

description_txt: stated on January 13, 2015 in a speech:
quote_txt: On Common Core education standards

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2015 in a statement on a website:
quote_txt: "Currently, Florida is one of only five states in the nation that prohibit citizens from buying electricity from companies that will put solar panels on your home or business."

description_txt: stated on January 6, 2015 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: Polls on legalizing same-sex marriage "are not dramatically changing."

description_txt: stated on November 19, 2014 in a tweet:
quote_txt: The streetcar project planned by Mayor Tom Barrett would be a "1900s style trolley."

description_txt: stated on November 25, 2014 in a website story:
quote_txt: "There’s nothing in the [RhodeMap RI] plan that takes away local government control and local zoning control."

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2015 in the governor's State of the State address:
quote_txt: "Georgia is now the eighth most populous state in the nation, moving from the number 10 position in just four years."

description_txt: stated on January 15, 2015 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: Tampa Bay is "leading the state in jobs creation."

description_txt: stated on January 15, 2015 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: Says he "secured the highest possible bond rating" for the city of Tampa.

description_txt: stated on January 13, 2015 in a press conference:
quote_txt: "About 30 percent" of those released from Guantanamo "have re-entered the fight."

description_txt: stated on January 13, 2015 in a meme on social media:
quote_txt: Says. Rep. Joe Barton, R-Texas, once said, "Wind is a finite resource and harnessing it would slow the winds down, which would cause the temperature to go up."

description_txt: stated on December 31, 2014 in a meme circulated on Facebook:
quote_txt: Milwaukee "incarcerates 1.2% of white men" and has "incarcerated over 50% of black men in their 30s."

description_txt: stated on January 10, 2015 in an interview on Fox News:
quote_txt: "There are actual cities" like Birmingham, England, "that are totally Muslim where non-Muslims just simply don’t go in."

description_txt: stated on January 11, 2015 in a "Washington Post" op-ed:
quote_txt: The Obama administration "supported Muslim allies trying to establish a new international blasphemy standard."

description_txt: stated on January 13, 2015 in his book, "American Dreams":
quote_txt: "If people work and make more money, they lose more in benefits than they would earn in salary."

description_txt: stated on January 7, 2015 in a tweet:
quote_txt: Says Mitch McConnell credits Republicans "for recent economic improvements" even though they took control of the Senate only "days ago."
